author: William Baldwin
title: Best ETFs: Municipal Bonds
text:
Itâ€™s hard to get enthusiastic about this part of the ETF market. Assets and trading volumes are fairly low, and partly for that reason the costs are fairly high.The best-established tax-exempt exchange-traded fund, iShares National AMT-Free Muni ( MUB ), has only $5 billion. It will cost you $411 to put away $10,000 in this fund for a decade.Short-term (and low-yielding) munis can be had at SPDR Nuveen Barclays Short-Term Municipal ( SHM ) and at Market Vectors Short Municipal ( SMB ).If you have a lot of money to put into tax-exempt bonds for a long time your best bet at the moment is to open an account at Vanguard and buy one of its open-end funds. For smaller sums the ETFs may be a convenient place to park money in a non-Vanguard brokerage account.Rules for the Best ETFs scorecard, and links to 13 categories of funds, can be found here .
